defaultValue: No gurantees for stability if you fuck with anything in here because I did not test it and probably never will.

fieldDescription: The row amount in most of the ship picker dialogues in the mod. This one is for DemonX3#6370 who badgered me to add this for a year straight.
Commerce balance changes. Read up on why this was needed here: bit.ly/commerce_balance. Can be disabled during an ongoing campaign to revert to vanilla behaviour (might need to re-dock).
Enables or disables the Variable Manufactory. Note that disabling the Variable industries will not stop VPCs from dropping - you will have to remove the entries from drop_groups.csv to achive that.

Setting this to true makes planetary governments behave like vanilla pop&infra and turns them into a cosmetic choice.

Specifies how large a colony may be to in order to change the government type. Building up a stable colony and then changing is cheating and takes away from how these are supposed to work: higher rewards for higher difficulties.
All derelict industry output will be delivered to the gathering point instead of local storage. Remember - courier port exists.
Derelict infra build cost and time reductuctions
Toggles Pets, the pet cryochamber dropping in campaign, abandoned pet stations spawning and the industry being available.
Enables salvage events as well as derelict infrastructure and industries
Amount of Coronal Taps * number = amount of automated shipyards. Default taps is 2, so default shipyards is 3 (2 * 1.5). Rounds up.
Master chance for a special event to be applied to an entity that does not have one. Note that the chance is actually lower as every entity has a defined chance to resolve to nothing.
Enables the custom station types like orbital labs and arsenal stations
Amount of additional stations with custom types spawned on top of existing ones (0.2 = 20%% additional)
Makes starship components drop from combat - Relic components will still drop even if you disable this.

How likely a system is to have an artillery station. Reduce this number to make them rarer. 1 = between 5-10%% of all systems will have one.

fieldName: [Salvage Yards] D-Mod Moving Base Cost Mult
fieldDescription: How much it costs to move a D-Mod compared to restoring it. By default, it's cheaper to move the D-mod by 0.8x the restoration cost. I think. Can't remember, might also be total cost.
